All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.lang.Runnable, java.io.Serializable, SoftWoehr, verbose
public class ShellFrame
extends java.awt.Frame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.lang.Runnable, SoftWoehr, verbose

Frame holding the ShellTextArea where user types and interpreter responds. Also holds the menu(s).

Version:
$Revision: 1.1.1.1 $
Author:
$Author: jwoehr $
See Also:

keyTyped

public void keyTyped(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
Handle key actions for the Text Frame, if we want to. Currently, all we care about is VK_ENTER. Currently, not used. There's not an easy way to "get current line" in java.awt.TextArea.
Specified by:
